definition: surname Ji/ancient Chinese city state near modern day Beijing

sentences.english: We strode down the open corridors together in our solitary fancy tasting artichokes.
sentences.chinese: 我们一起来到宽敞的过道在寂寞中奇想品尝洋蓟。

sentences.english: Clara's family would have stuffed artichokes for the holidays.
sentences.chinese: 在年终节日期间，克莱拉全家会吃填馅洋蓟。

sentences.english: First, cut off the thorns and the bottom so that the artichokes stand upright.
sentences.chinese: 首先，把洋蓟的刺和根部都削掉，让洋蓟可以立住。

sentences.english: First, cut off the thorns and the bottom so that the artichokes stand upright.
sentences.chinese: 首先，把洋蓟的刺和根部都削掉，让洋蓟可以立住。

sentences.english: The edible, immature flower head of this plant.
sentences.chinese: 洋蓟花头这种植物的可食用的，未成熟的花头。

sentences.english: A tetrasaccharide found in the tubers of the chinese artichoke.
sentences.chinese: 中国洋蓟的块茎中发现的四糖。

sentences.english: Vegetable choices go all the way from artichokes to zucchini.
sentences.chinese: 常吃的蔬菜各色各样，从洋蓟到绿皮密生西葫芦。

sentences.english: Gourmet salad with goose liver and shrimps shaves of Parma ham.
sentences.chinese: 美味沙拉配鹅肝，鲜虾，火腿，洋蓟和蘑菇。

sentences.english: Grilled chicken breast with capers, olives, and artichoke in marinara sauce.
sentences.chinese: 扒鸡胸配水瓜柳，橄榄，洋蓟心蕃茄汁。

sentences.english: Olives, marinated veg like eggplant, artichokes or peppers all make wonderful quick snacks.
sentences.chinese: 橄榄，腌制的蔬菜，洋蓟或者甜椒都是很便捷的小吃。

sentences.english: Stir in the garlic, artichokes, leeks, and white wine.
sentences.chinese: 加入蒜头，洋蓟，韭葱和白葡萄酒。

definition: Brussels sprouts (Brassica oleracea L. var. gemmifera)
